title: [Large-scale] Scientific Inquiry Competency Optimization Course Using Computer-managed Learning Systems

context.prior_knowledge: Basic computer literacy, secondary-level science knowledge (including experience in experimental design, observation, and measurement)
context.additional_context: Learners access modular science content (15-20 minutes daily via mobile devices, including hypothesis verification and data analysis activities) on a platform with peer feedback systems. Applies a step-by-step evaluation system for the scientific inquiry process (observation → hypothesis → experiment → conclusion).

learning_goals: Learners design individualized learning paths via computer-managed systems with 90% accuracy, strengthening experimental variable and hypothesis-setting skills
Using peer feedback systems, learners interact ≥3 times weekly, applying scientific evidence analysis and conclusion derivation processes ≥80% of the time
Through formative assessments, learners improve understanding of physics and chemistry concepts from 75% to 90% accuracy and acquire data analysis skills
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
